moviegenerator

Class MovieList

  • java.lang.Object
    • moviegenerator.MovieList

  • public class MovieList
extends java.lang.Object
    The MovieList class is responsible for handling the list of movies.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovieList()
      Constructor used for initiate arrayList with movies

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMovie(java.lang.String mTitle, java.lang.String mGenre, java.lang.String mDirector, int mAge, int mTime)
      Adds a movie into list
      int getNumberOfMovies()
      Returns the number of movies in the list
      java.lang.String movieListToString(java.lang.String format)
      Puts the list of movies into a formatted string
      java.lang.String removeMovie(int movieNo)
      Removes a movie from the list

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovieList

        public MovieList()
        Constructor used for initiate arrayList with movies

    • Method Detail

      • movieListToString

        public java.lang.String movieListToString(java.lang.String format)
        Puts the list of movies into a formatted string
        Parameters:
        format - Format of the string
        Returns:
        The string of movies

      • addMovie

        public void addMovie(java.lang.String mTitle,
            java.lang.String mGenre,
            java.lang.String mDirector,
            int mAge,
            int mTime)
        Adds a movie into list
        Parameters:
        mTitle - The title of the movie to add
        mGenre - The genre of the movie, for example children
        mDirector - The director of the movie to add
        mAge - The age which the movie is allowed from
        mTime - The time in minutes which the movie last

      • removeMovie

        public java.lang.String removeMovie(int movieNo)
        Removes a movie from the list
        Parameters:
        movieNo - The movie number to be removed. Note! This parameter should not be the list number but the number as the user see (number in list + 1)
        Returns:
        The title of the removed movie

      • getNumberOfMovies

        public int getNumberOfMovies()
        Returns the number of movies in the list
        Returns:
        The current number of movies
